intro: Stylidium leiophyllum, commonly known as the smooth-leaved triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique trigger mechanism that aids in pollination. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, attracting nectar-feeding insects. Stylidium leiophyllum is a small, herbaceous plant that thrives in well-drained environments.
